greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (eta(q) * eta(q^4) / eta(q^2)^2)^24 in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q / chi(q)^24 in powers of q where chi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
Expansion of lambda * (1 - lambda) / 16 in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (4 t)) = f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
a(n) = -(-1)^n * A014103(n). Convolution inverse of A097340. Series reversion of A195130.
mathematica: a[ n_] := With[ {m = InverseEllipticNomeQ @ q}, SeriesCoefficient[ (1 - m) m / 16, {q, 0, n}]];
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ q / Product[ 1 + q^k, {k, 1, n, 2}]^24, {q, 0, n}];
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ q / QPochhammer[ -q, q^2]^24, {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = polcoeff( x * prod(k=1, n, 1 + (-x)^k, 1 + x * O(x^n))^24, n)};
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<1, 0,  n--; A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x + A) * eta(x^4 + A) / eta(x^2 + A)^2)^24, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Nov 06 2004
ext: Swapped a formula with definition to make this clearer. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 26 2018
